Detailed Description

WebView's child signal handlers.

Function Documentation

static gboolean webview_signal_download_cb ( CreamModule *  self,
GtkWidget *  webview,
const gchar *  file,
WebView *  w 
) [static]
Parameters:
selfA CreamModule object.
webviewThe child of a WebView.
fileFile URI to download.
wA WebView object.
Returns:
TRUE if the signal was handled (will stop all other handlers).

This function handles the signal "download" which is emitted when the user attempt to start a download (or when the webview can't show the file's content). This handler emit the signal "download"

static void webview_signal_favicon_changed_cb ( CreamModule *  self,
GtkWidget *  webview,
GdkPixbuf *  pixbuf,
WebView *  w 
) [static]
Parameters:
selfA CreamModule object.
webviewThe child of a WebView.
pixbufThe favicon's GdkPixbuf.
wA WebView object.

This function handles the signal "favicon-changed" which is emitted when the favicon is loaded. This handler emit the signal "favicon-changed".

static void webview_signal_grab_focus_cb ( GtkWidget *  child,
WebView *  w 
) [static]
Parameters:
childThe child widget (owned by the CreamModule).
wA WebView object.

This function handles the signal "grab-focus" which is emitted when the child widget requests the focus. This handler requestsa the focus on the WebView.

See also:
"focus-changed"
static void webview_signal_progress_changed_cb ( CreamModule *  self,
GtkWidget *  webview,
gdouble  progress,
WebView *  w 
) [static]
Parameters:
selfA CreamModule object.
webviewThe child of a WebView.
progressThe load progress.
wA WebView object.

This function handles the signal "progress-changed" which is emitted on the page's loading. This handler is able to modify the Statusbar and emit the signal "status-changed".

Here is the call graph for this function:

static void webview_signal_state_changed_cb ( CreamModule *  self,
GtkWidget *  webview,
CreamMode  state,
WebView *  w 
) [static]
Parameters:
selfA CreamModule object.
webviewThe child of a WebView.
stateSee CreamMode.
wA WebView object.

This function handles the signal "state-changed" which is emitted when the child widget wants to modify the CreamBrowser's state.

Here is the call graph for this function:

static void webview_signal_title_changed_cb ( CreamModule *  self,
GtkWidget *  webview,
const gchar *  title,
WebView *  w 
) [static]
Parameters:
selfA CreamModule object.
webviewThe child of a WebView.
titleThe new page's title.
wA WebView object.

This function handles the signal "title-changed" which is emitted when the loaded page changes its title. This handler is able to modify the toplevel window and emit the signal "title-changed".

Here is the call graph for this function:

static void webview_signal_uri_changed_cb ( CreamModule *  self,
GtkWidget *  webview,
const gchar *  uri,
WebView *  w 
) [static]
Parameters:
selfA CreamModule object.
webviewThe child widget of a WebView.
uriThe new URI loaded.
wA WebView object.

This function handles the signal "uri-changed" which is emitted when the child widget of a WebView request the loading of a new URI. This handler is able to modify the Statusbar and emit the signal "uri-changed".
